intro: Phaeopappus aintabicus, commonly known as the Aintab spurge, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers. The plant has rough, hairy stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped. It thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
